channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The real ping pong champion — and hustler — who inspired 'Marty Supreme'
item.description: Marty Reisman was nicknamed "The Needle" for his slender physique. He dressed well and put on a show.
item.content:encoded:
Marty Reisman was nicknamed "The Needle" for his slender physique. He dressed well and put on a show.

(Image credit: Ed Ford)
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Blair

item.title: A holiday tradition: David Sedaris reads from 'The Santaland Diaries'
item.description: Writer and humorist David Sedaris reads from his holiday essay "The Santaland Diaries."
item.content:encoded: Writer and humorist David Sedaris reads from his holiday essay "The Santaland Diaries."

item.title: Morning Edition hosts play 'Do You Know Your Ho-Ho-Ho!'
item.description: Morning Edition hosts Michel Martin and Leila Fadel answer holiday trivia questions compiled by Southern Living Magazine.
item.content:encoded: Morning Edition hosts Michel Martin and Leila Fadel answer holiday trivia questions compiled by Southern Living Magazine.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: DOJ says it may need a 'few more weeks' to finish releasing Epstein files
item.description: The Justice Department said Wednesday that it may need a "few more weeks" to release its records on the late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein after discovering more than a million potentially relevant documents.
item.content:encoded:
The Justice Department said Wednesday that it may need a "few more weeks" to release its records on the late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein after discovering more than a million potentially relevant documents.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: A Powerball player in Arkansas has won a $1.817 billion lottery jackpot
item.description: Wednesday's Christmas Eve drawing ended the lottery game's three-month stretch without a top-prize winner. Final ticket sales pushed the jackpot higher, making it the second-largest in U.S. history.
item.content:encoded:
Wednesday's Christmas Eve drawing ended the lottery game's three-month stretch without a top-prize winner. Final ticket sales pushed the jackpot higher, making it the second-largest in U.S. history.

(Image credit: Charles Krupa)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump-backed candidate Nasry Asfura declared winner of Honduras' presidential vote
item.description: Asfura won Honduras' presidential election, electoral authorities said Wednesday afternoon, ending a weeks-long count that has whittled away at the credibility of the nation's electoral system.
item.content:encoded:
Asfura won Honduras' presidential election, electoral authorities said Wednesday afternoon, ending a weeks-long count that has whittled away at the credibility of the nation's electoral system.

(Image credit: Moises Castillo)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Greetings from Jaffa, Israel, where a salon is a welcoming space for Palestinians and Jews
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.
item.content:encoded: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.
item.dc:creator: Hadeel Al-Shalchi

item.title: In the snow, these salamanders get supercool
item.description: Blue spotted salamanders have been seen walking across snow and new research suggests how they get by in the cold.
item.content:encoded:
Blue spotted salamanders have been seen walking across snow and new research suggests how they get by in the cold.

(Image credit: Peter Paplanus)
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: When porch pirates steal medicine instead of holiday gifts
item.description: Mail theft can happen around the holidays, but sometimes, instead of getting a new iPad, the thief swipes a mail order medicine. Here's what to do about it.
item.content:encoded: Mail theft can happen around the holidays, but sometimes, instead of getting a new iPad, the thief swipes a mail order medicine. Here's what to do about it.
item.dc:creator: Sydney Lupkin

item.title: New Epstein files mention Trump. And, SCOTUS rules on National Guard in Chicago
item.description: The DOJ released tens of thousands of new documents related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. And, the Supreme Court ruled that the National Guard must stay out of Chicago.
item.content:encoded:
The DOJ released tens of thousands of new documents related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. And, the Supreme Court ruled that the National Guard must stay out of Chicago.

(Image credit: Davidoff Studios)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen
